original: Hugo, Åke Hugo, direktör, Norrköping, f. 8/6/79 i Furingsta, östergötl. 1. G. m. Alma Olsson. Barn: Arne f. 11, jur. kand., Maj Tullia 20, fil. stud. — Mog:ex. i Norrköp. 97, John Lennings väfsk. 97-98, prakt, i sv. yl-leind. 98-00, École Sup. des Textiles i Verviers, Belg., 01-02. Föret, ett stort antal stud:- o. affärsres. i uti. Lär. v. John Lennings väfsk. 00-01 o. 11-13, anst. i yltleind. i USA 02-08, kont :chef h. Knut Evers & Co. i Norrköp. 09-15, v. samma föret, i Gbg 16-18, tj :-man v. stat. ind:komm. 18, dir:assist. v. Borås Väfveri A-B 18-20, verkst. dir. f. Sv. Boniullsspinn. Imp. A-B i Gbg 20-22, Gen. Cont. Manager f. bomullsexp :firman Bush & Wither-spoon Co. i Texas 22-26, anst. h. STAB m. tjg. i Belg., Ungern o. Algeriet 26-30, verkst. dir. f. Sv. Ullimp ifören. u. p. a. 39-46, etabl. egen firma f. textila råvaror 32. Statens repr. i styr. f. flera imp:fören. 18. Sekr. i Norrköp. Rotarykl. 3’4-39, preses 39-41, v. preses i Alliance Frang. de Norrköp. 43.
translated:
Hugo, Åke Hugo, director, Norrköping, born June 8, 1879 in Furingsta, Östergötland. First married to Alma Olsson. Children: Arne born in 1911, law graduate, Maj Tullia born in 1920, philosophy student. 

Hugo completed his secondary education in Norrköping in 1897, attended John Lennings väfsk. in 1897-1898, and worked in the Swedish woolen textile industry from 1898-1900. He then attended École Sup. des Textiles in Verviers, Belgium from 1901-1902. He conducted a large number of study and business trips abroad. He worked as a teacher at John Lennings väfsk. in 1900-1901 and 1911-1913, worked in the woolen textile industry in the USA from 1902-1908, was the head of the Knut Evers & Co. office in Norrköping from 1909-1915, worked for the same company in Gothenburg from 1916-1918, was a government official from 1918, was the directorial assistant of Borås Väfveri A-B from 1918-1920, was the managing director of the Swedish Boniullsspinn. Imp. A-B in Gothenburg from 1920-1922, was a General Cont. Manager for the cotton exporting firm Bush & Witherspoon Co. in Texas from 1922-1926, worked for STAB with positions in Belgium, Hungary, and Algeria from 1926-1930, was the managing director of the Swedish woolen importing firm Ullimp ifören. u. p. a. 1939-1946, and established his own firm for textile raw materials in 1932. He was a representative of the state in the boards of several import firms in 1918. He was Secretary in Norrköping Rotary Club from 1934-1939, President from 1939-1941, and Vice President of the Alliance Frang. de Norrköp. in 1943.

structured.name: Åke Hugo
structured.description: Hugo conducted a large number of study and business trips abroad and worked as a teacher, director, and manager for various textile companies in Sweden, the USA, and Belgium.
